business.headline: Looking for tax benefits under Section 80C? Check these 5 optionsThe contributions made to the Public Provident Fund qualify for tax deductions under Section 80C and the interest earned, along with the maturity amount, is tax-free.

Reliance share price jumps 3% today. Good time to buy stock?Reliance stock price: The company's stock was up 3.41% to Rs 1,251.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:56 am. However, it is still down over 20% compared to its 52-week high of Rs 1,608.95.

What is EPFO 3.0? All you need to knowWhile inaugurating EPFO's Telangana zonal office and regional office in Hyderabad, Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya mentioned that the upgraded system will bring EPFO's services closer to a banking experience.

Race against time: What's India doing to deal with US reciprocal tariffs?With US reciprocal tariffs kicking in on April 2, the government is reportedly considering tariff cuts on key imports while companies across sectors engage with American partners to safeguard their businesses.

Blinkit, Zepto to raise commissions as quick commerce battle intensifies: ReportZepto has been steadily hiking commissions for both users and brands, focusing on unit economics, while Blinkit is rolling out a variable commission model.

Is the bull market dead? Ace investor Shankar Sharma cautions investors for 2025When questioned if small investors can bear losses like experienced traders, Sharma said that all successful investors once started small but grew by overcoming challenges.

Good news from GCCs: Hiring set to outpace IT firms for second year in a rowWith global businesses continuing to expand their operations in India, GCCs (Global capability centres) are expected to play a bigger role in the job market, as per experts.

Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag market in early trade; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex fell 206.29 points to 74,133.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 63.30 points to 22,481.40 as of 9:17 AM.

Tariff uncertainty clobbers US markets, Nasdaq crashes 10%, S&P slidesStocks fell even though President Trump offered a one-month reprieve from his 25% tariffs on many goods imported from Mexico and Canada. That's unlike the bounce stocks got the prior day from his giving a one-month exemption specifically for automakers.

India to monitor negotiations before taking a call on US tariffs: Finance MinisterFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal is currently in the United States for discussions, and India will wait for the outcome before taking a stance.
L&T introduces one-day paid menstrual leave for women employeesThe announcement was made by Chairman and Managing Director S N Subrahmanyan during an event held to mark International Women's Day.

Bitcoin prices fall 5% after Donald Trump orders US strategic reserveBitcoin prices dropped over 5% a day before Donald Trump is set to meet with top executives from the cryptocurrency industry at the White House.

entertainment.headline: Dupahiya review: A wholesome watch for your next relaxed weekendReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025Dupahiya review: This Prime Video series is a charming small-town comedy with endearing performances, witty dialogues, and social themes. While it drags at times, its humour and heart make it a delightful, easy watch.

Unpopular opinion: Korean star Lee Min-ho is overratedSouth Korean star Lee Min-ho is a beloved actor. But he is certainly not the most talented or versatile artiste out there. Min-ho is currently seen in the show, When the Stars Gossip, which is streaming on Netflix.

The Waking of a Nation review: Ram Madhvani's sincere attempt leaves little impactReleased-Thu Mar 06, 2025The Waking of a Nation review: Director Ram Madhvani's show explores the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre over six episodes. The show is streaming on SonyLIV.

Singer Shawn Mendes shops in Mumbai's Colaba, goes unnoticed by fansSinger Shawn Mendes has arrived in Mumbai to perform at the Lollapalooza. His casual shopping spree in a vest and flip-flops has caught fans' attention.

Friends actor recalls 'toxic environment' on set: I had become so race-consciousActor Stephen Park shared his negative experiences on the set of Friends, highlighting racial insensitivity. He recalled an incident involving an assistant director's offensive remarks towards fellow actor James Hong.

BB 17's Ayesha Khan faints while shooting, video goes viralBigg Boss 17 fae Ayesha Khan fainted on the sets of her upcoming project. Reportedly, the incident took place on Kapil Sharma's Kis Kisko Pyaar Karun set.

Nora Fatehi, Jason Durelo teach Kelly Clarkson Snake hook step. WatchKelly Clarkson welcomed Nora Fatehi and Jason Derulo on her talk show, where they showcased their latest hit, Snake, and even taught Kelly the hook step.

Lisa Kudrow's No Good Deed: This dark comedy could have been darker and funnierLisa Kudrow and Ray Romano are beloved comedic actors. And they deserved better treatment than Netflix's No Good Deed, which is fine at best. The series is currently streaming on the OTT platform.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

Netflix cancels Noah Centineo-led The Recruit after 2 seasonsStreaming giant Netflix has cancelled actor Noah Centineo-starrer The Recruit after only two seasons. The news was recently confirmed by the OTT platform.

Daredevil Born Again review: An uneven but triumphant return of Hell's Kitchen's devilReleased-Wed Mar 05, 2025Matt Murdock is back as Hell's Kitchen's favourite vigilante in Marvel Studios' Daredevil Born Again. The show had its two-episode premiere on March 5 and can be streamed on JioHotstar.

Ali Fazal trains 7 hours a day for Rakht Brahmand, learns ancient martial artsAli Fazal undergoes 7-hour daily training, learning martial arts and perfecting diction for Rakht Brahmand. He calls the process "demanding but rewarding." The series also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.
Bigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal gets engaged to girlfriend RitikaBigg Boss 17's Anurag Dobhal got engaged to his girlfriend Ritika Chauhan. The vlogger shared pictures on Instagram on March 5.

Madhavan, Nayanthara, Siddharth's Netflix film Test to premiere on April 4Madhavan, Nayanthara, and Siddharth star in Test, a Tamil Netflix film exploring life's biggest challenges beyond cricket. Directed by S. Sashikanth, it will stream from April 4.

Liam Payne's girlfriend breaks down remembering singer, says 'can't fully accept'One Direction singer Liam Payne's untimely demise has left his girlfriend Kate Cassidy grappling with grief. In a heartfelt interview, she talked about her struggles and healing journey.

Actor Parambrata jokes about playing a cop ahead of Khakee: The Bengal ChapterActor Parambrata Chattopadhyay recently joked about playing a police officer ahead of his Netflix series, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter. The actor even shared reasons behind nodding to feature in the political drama.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter trailer: Neeraj Pandey show dives into politics, crimeThe trailer for Khakee The Bengal Chapter was unveiled on March 5. The show promises a riveting series filled with action, drama, and political intrigue.
K-pop group SEVENTEEN member Wonwoo to enlist in military in AprilSEVENTEEN's Wonwoo is set to begin his mandatory military service in April, as confirmed by Pledis Entertainment.

Lollapalooza 2025: Shawn Mendes, Louis Tomlinson to make India debutLollapalooza India is making a grand return in 2025 at Mumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse. With an eclectic lineup featuring Green Day, Shawn Mendes, and more, this festival promises an unforgettable musical experience.

Actor Sumbul Touqeer blasts trolls for body-shaming: Never been more madTelevision actor Sumbul Touqeer Khan has addressed the body-shaming and trolling she faced in a recent social media post. She clarified that her weight gain was due to medication and urged trolls to stop their unwarranted comments.

With Love, Meghan first reviews: Meghan Markle's show called queasy, unlovableIn 'With Love, Meghan', Meghan Markle arranges flowers, cooks delectable exquisite food with her celebrity friends, and gives stunning glimpses of her gorgeous Montecito house with a sprawling ocean view.

Severance creator Ben Stiller requested Obama for cameo in show. Here's how it wentSeverance creator and actor Ben Stiller wanted former US President Barack Obama to appear in his acclaimed Apple TV show, Severance. However, his request was politely turned down.

Black Doves: Keira Knightley show is essential viewing for thriller enthusiastsBritish stars Keira Knightley and Ben Whishaw's thriller series Black Doves is both relentless and rewarding. The underrated gem is currently streaming on Netflix.
Sana Khan faces backlash after asking Sambhavna Seth to wear burqa for her podcastSana Khan found herself in the spotlight after a video of her asking Sambhavna Seth to wear a burqa went viral.

Aashram 3 Part 2: Aaditi Pohankar's Pammi outshines Bobby Deol's Baba NiralaAaditi Pohankar's character as Pammi has garnered her immense love and appreciation from fans. Her fierce portrayal and her quest to take revenge against Bobby Deol's Baba Nirala truly makes her the hero of the series.

Bobby Deol had a vertigo attack while promoting Aashram: Was very nervousActor Bobby Deol recently revealed that he suffered from a vertigo attack while promoting his popular show Aashram. The actor is currently seen in the latest season of the show, which is streaming on MX Player.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

Kanye West's wife Bianca goes nude again after controversial Grammy outingKanye West's wife Bianca Censori went nude for a photoshoot. This comes a month after her controversial 'nude' outfit at the Grammys.

Actor Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to divorce rumours: Dipika ne diya mujhe dhokhaTelevision couple, Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim have found themselves at the center of the separation rumours. The two addressed the same in their new vlog on YouTube.

Shonali Bose on DU, Miranda House's objection to Ziddi Girls: It was heartbreakingPrime Video's Ziddi Girls faced backlash from sections of Delhi University and Miranda House students over perceived negative portrayal, but director Shonali Bose clarifies the trailer was misunderstood and most students ultimately enjoyed the show.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.
Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

general news.headline: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta's fiery 'sheeshmahal' dig at Arvind KejriwalIn a dig at AAP chief and her predecessor, Rekha Gupta said that she is not the kind of Chief Minister who sits and works in 'sheeshmahal'. She made the remark while speaking at the India Today Conclave being held at Delhi's Taj Palace.

Actor Ranya Rao 'confesses': 17 gold bars, several trips to US, Europe, DubaiIn the statement recorded during questioning, Kannada actor Ranya Rao confessed to committing the crime and admitted that authorities recovered 17 gold bars from her possession.

Democracy a conversation between rulers and ruled: Aroon Purie at Conclave 2025Aroon Purie, Chairman and Editor-in-Chief of the India Today Group, addressed Donald Trump's return to power, the impact of artificial intelligence, and the age of acceleration in his welcome speech at the 22nd India Today Conclave.

Trudeau breaks down on camera amid Trump's tariff war: I put Canadians firstAn emotional Justin Trudeau broke down while reflecting on the chaotic moments of his nine-year tenure. He will step down as Prime Minister once the ruling Liberal Party chooses a new leader this Sunday.

Why do Naga Sadhus smoke chillum? Seer opens up on use of ganjaSmoking marijuana in a chillum is widespread among the recluse Naga Sadhus and is a part of their way of life. The issue was touched upon by Maniraj Puri Maharaj at the India Today Conclave.

Rohit, Kohli to end ODI careers after Champions Trophy? Aakash Chopra reactsAs India prepares for the Champions Trophy final, speculation grows over whether Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will retire from ODIs, with Aakash Chopra weighing in on the possibility of them stepping away from the format.

This Chief Minister can't be controlled: Rekha Gupta's quip on MCD chaos videoFootage of the chaotic scenes of vandalism at the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) House that erupted following the 2023 mayoral polls resurfaced after Rekha Gupta assumed office last month.

Wear jeans but don't forget about genes: Spiritual head Chidanand SaraswatiChidanand Saraswati, spiritual head of Parmarth Niketan Ashram, said on Friday that there is no problem with wearing jeans, but people should not forget about their genes.

Feel like Nayak picture ki naayika: Rekha Gupta on becoming Delhi Chief MinisterDelhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said she had never envisioned holding the top post and credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for fulfilling his commitment to women-led development and governance.

Bengaluru eatery's 'no political, real estate discussions' rule for diners sparks debatePaakashala has put up a signboard urging diners to steer clear of real estate and political discussions while enjoying their meals.

'Dragon and Elephant Dance': Chinese Minister bats for stronger India tiesChina's Finance Minister Wang Yi urged India and China to cooperate as partners, not rivals, stressing diplomacy to resolve disputes. His remarks followed recent talks with Indian counterpart S Jaishankar on bilateral concerns.

Tughlaq Lane now Vivekananda Marg? BJP MP changes nameplate for Delhi houseBJP MP Dinesh Sharma renamed Tughlaq Lane to "Swami Vivekananda Marg", intensifying the party's broader push to rename areas linked to Muslim rulers. Similar nameplate changes were also seen outside houses of other BJP leaders in Delhi.

Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda dine out with Shweta Bachchan amid dating rumoursSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda dined out with Shweta Bachchan, avoiding paparazzi. The rumoured couple previously celebrated New Year together.

26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana's plea to pause extradition rejected by US courtTahawwur Rana's extradition was approved by US President Donald Trump during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last month. Rana, 63, is currently lodged at a jail in Los Angeles.

Holi comes once a year, Friday namaz 52 times: UP cop's remark triggers rowA Sambhal police officer's advice for those uncomfortable with Holi colours to stay indoors has sparked political backlash, with opposition leaders condemning the remarks as biased and demanding action.

Islam a scientific religion: Congress leader's take on Mohammed Shami's roza rowCongress leader Shama Mohamed defended Indian pacer Mohammed Shami after Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi Bareilvi called him a "criminal" for skipping roza during India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia.

Rise in fatty liver cases among young Indians. Can it be reversed?A recent study found that 80 per cent of IT professionals in India have fatty liver, due to work pressure, a sedentary lifestyle and poor lifestyle choices.

Telugu actor blasts photographers for ignoring request not to take picsTelugu actor Rukshar Dhillon called out the photographers at Dilruba event for ignoring her discomfort and continuing to take pictures. She sent out a stern message at the event in Hyderabad.

What happened in India and New Zealand's only meeting in the final? Champions Trophy: In their only meeting in the final of the tournament back in 2000, Chris Cairns' 102 not out overshadowed Sourav Ganguly's 117 as New Zealand beat India by four wickets in Nairobi.

Ex-MP's grandson opens fire inside Lucknow IT firm, assaults 2 with pistol buttThe accused, identified as Vivek Bhadauria, works as a property dealer and is the grandson of former MP Arjun Singh. Vivek was arrested soon after.

Mithya review: A symbolic display of stages of grief through an 11-year-old's lifeReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025Mithya movie review: Director Sumanth Bhat's Mithya, produced by Rakshit Shetty under Paramvah Studios, is a Kannada film about a young boy and his struggle to navigate through emotional turmoil due to traumatic experiences.

sports.headline: Rohit, Kohli to end ODI careers after Champions Trophy? Aakash Chopra reactsAs India prepares for the Champions Trophy final, speculation grows over whether Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will retire from ODIs, with Aakash Chopra weighing in on the possibility of them stepping away from the format.

Harmanpreet engages in fiery spat with Sophie Ecclestone, BCCI fines her WPL 2025: Harmanpreet Kaur was fined 10 per cent of her match fees after showing dissent at an umpire's decision during the clash between Mumbai Indians and UP Warriorz on Thursday.

Emma Raducanu crashes out on emotional return after stalking incidentIndian Wells 2025: Emma Raducanu couldn't go through to the second round of the tournament after Moyuka Uchijima of Japan defeated her 6-3, 6-2 on Thursday, March 6.

Inspired by Virat Kohli's work ethics, India's Sayali aims to soar high In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Indian all-rounder Sayali Satghare spoke about her recent debut for the national team in the series against Ireland and also shared her experience of playing for the Gujarat Giants in the WPL.

Bear with the bullies: Is powerhouse India facing fair scrutiny or sour grapes?India's dominance in cricket sparks controversy as critics question fairness of the side playing all their Champions Trophy fixtures in Dubai and not the original venue in Pakistan. India face off against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy Final on March 9.

Suryakumar defends Rohit amid 'captaincy' row: Led us to 4 ICC FinalsSuryakumar Yadav defended Rohit Sharma against criticism, highlighting his leadership in guiding India to four ICC finals. He reminded of Rohit leading India to the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph, as the team gears up for the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.

England Cricket Board issues apology for 'ill-judged' Pope Francis jokeThe England and Wales Cricket Board faced backlash after joking about Pope Francis "loving the Ashes" in response to his Ash Wednesday message. The post was deleted, and ECB issued an apology for the insensitivity.

IND vs NZ: Virat Kohli's calmness gives Gautam Gambhir's India its ODI identityIn an era when every team needs to have an 'identity', India's ODI team under Gautam Gambhir is deriving its spirit from the calmness of Virat Kohli. The star batter has been in sensational form for India in the Champions Trophy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
